metadata.feature_description: Provides integration point for Evoq Assistant chat feature within PersonaBar.

steps.action: Logged in as superuser (host) and observed page load
steps.expected: Copilot/Assistant feature should initialize and display welcome dialog
steps.actual: Welcome to Copilot! dialog appeared immediately after login, showing keyboard shortcuts (Mac: ctrl+/ and Win: Alt+/) for activating Copilot on inputs

steps.expected: Dialog should show how to activate Copilot feature
steps.actual: Dialog displayed keyboard shortcuts and an example of Copilot integrated with form fields (Approved checkbox, Tags input, Publishing dropdown)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Assistant UI integration in PersonaBar

steps.expected: PersonaBar should be visible with Evoq styling and menu items
steps.actual: PersonaBar displayed with Evoq branding, showing Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, and user account icons. The integration is via Copilot embedded in inputs rather than a separate menu item.

steps.action: Entered edit mode via PersonaBar Edit button
steps.expected: Edit mode should activate with Copilot integration visible
steps.actual: Edit mode activated successfully. Copilot welcome dialog appeared again in edit mode context, demonstrating the integration is active across the admin experience.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Assistant availability based on license

steps.action: Verified trial license status and Copilot availability
steps.expected: Copilot/Assistant should be available with trial license
steps.actual: Site shows 'You are using a trial version of Evoq Engage. You currently have 30 days remaining before your trial period expires.' The Copilot feature is fully active and functional with the trial license.

observations: The Evoq Assistant Integration is implemented as 'Copilot' - an AI-powered input assistance feature that activates via keyboard shortcuts (Alt+/ on Windows, Ctrl+/ on Mac).

Code review of EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs confirms 'Evoq.Assistant' is defined as a root menu item (line 45) and the AssistantChat module is loaded when the user has VIEW permission and a valid license (lines 140-145).
The Copilot feature loads from an external AWS S3 bucket (dnn-copilot-react.js) and integrates with form inputs throughout the admin experience.
Console logs show 'active element is not valid' when attempting to activate Copilot on unsupported input types (e.g., search boxes), suggesting Copilot only works on specific form field types.
No dedicated 'Assistant' menu item exists in the PersonaBar sidebar - the integration is embedded directly into form inputs via the Copilot system.
The Copilot welcome dialog shows integration with blog publishing workflows (Tags, Author selection, Publishing options), indicating deep integration with content management features.
